INTERNATIONAL GRT / NRT: 30,704 / 18,492

CONSTANTS: 850MT EXCL FW & UNPUMPABLE.

UNPUMPABLE BALLAST 1000MT.

NUMBER OF HOLDS / HATCHES: 5/5

GEAR: CRANES 4 X 30 MT.

GRABS 4 NOS x 12CBM RADIO REMOTE CONTROLED.

SWL OF CRANE UNDER GRAB OPERATION IS SUBJECT TO TARE WEIGHT OF EMPTY GRAB & CARGO DENSITY.

GRAB SIZE REDUCED & USABLE TO 10,8 & 6 CBM.

GRABS SUITABLE FOR CARGO BULK DENSITY 0.8 TO 2.5 MT/CBM AND SWL OF CRANE UNDER GRAB OPERATION

MAX 24MT INCL GRAB TEAR WEIGHT. 

TARE WEIGHT OF EACH EMPTY GRAB 9MT, EACH VESSEL'S GRABS TO BE DE-RATED IN KEEPING WITH

ACCEPTABLE DENSITY /STOWAGE FACTOR OF

CARGO AND S.W.L. OF CRANES UNDER GRAB OPERATION.

VESSEL IS NOT SCRUBBER FITTED.

 

SPEED/CONSUMPTION

 

AT SEA 

LADEN ABOUT 11.00KN on 22MT/DAY LSFO +0.2MT LSMGO

BALLAST ABOUT 11.50KN on 22MT/DAY LSFO + 0.2MT LSMGO

IN PORT 

WORKING ABOUT 5.5MT IFO + 0.5MT/DAY LSMGO 

IDLE ABOUT 3.60MT IFO + 0.5MT LSMGO

 

ALL DETAILS ABOVE WOG.

 

AS PER OWNS COMPANY POLICY, CHARTERERS TO KEEP/MAINTAIN MINIMUM FIVE DAYS SAILING BUNKERS AS RESERVES ON BOARD AT ALL TIME. 

 

BUNKER SPECS ISO 8217 2005 or 2010 LSFO 380 RMG CST / LSMGO DMA.

 

BUNKERS TO BE SUPPLIED ALWAYS IN CONFORMITY WITH REGULATIONS 14 AND 18 OF ANNEX VI OF MARPOL 73/78

 

SULPHUR CONTAIN MAX 0.5% AS PER CURRENT MARPOL POLICY FOR EACH SUPPLY TO APPLY.

 

BIMCO BUNKER FUEL SULPHUR CONTENT LATEST CLAUSE FOR TIME TO APPLY.
 ADDITIONAL ABOUT 6 MTS IFO FOR EACH BALLAST EXCHANGE OPERATION AT SEA.

 

SPEED CONS DESCRIBED BASIS NO ADVERSE CURRENT/CALM SEAS & UNEXCEEDING 

BEAUFORT SCALE 4 AND DOUGLAS STATE 3 WAVE/SWEL (UPTO 1.25 MTRS)

 

SPEED/CONS DESCRIBED FROM SEABUOY TO SEABUOY. 

 

CALCULATION OF VESSEL’S PERFORMANCE ON BOTH LADEN AND BALLAST PASSAGES HAS TO BE BASED
 UPON AN AVERAGE SPEED/CONSUMPTION DURING WEATHER DAYS UPTO BEAUFORT SCALE 4 AND 

DOUGLAS STATE 3 (UPTO 1.25 MTRS). LADEN OR BALLAST SPEED AND CONUMPTION FOR PERIOD OF WEATHER IN 

EXCESS OF BEAUFORT SCALE 4 & DOUGLAS SEA STATE 3 (UPTO 1.25 MTRS)
 BE EXPRESSLY EXCLUDED FROM CALCULATIONS.

Speed and consumption figures basis up to summer draft, even keel (for laden passages) good weather conditions

up to max Beaufort 4, and/or significant wave height up to 1.25mtrs and no adverse influence of currents,

the first 24 hours and last 24 hours of any sea passage being excluded, also excluding periods with reduction of speed, in straits, in tidal affected waters, high risk piracy areas, due to reasons of safety/visibility or on charterers’ orders.

stopping or being idle if required. Cost of ballast treatment if required and any loss of speed / time to be for

charterers account.

the entire Charter period.

Fuel Quality

Charterers undertake to supply only fuel and diesel/gasoil complying with current ISO specifications at the time of supply.

VLSFO - 380 Centistoke ISO 8217:2017 (E) RMG 380 with max sulphur 0.50% Ultra Low Sulphur Marine Gas Oil (ULSMGO) with max sulphur 0.10% grade DMA 8217:2017 Min FIA/100 20 ECN (IP541). VLSFO purchased/supplied in different lots must be segregated.

 

All Fuel shall consist of hydrocarbons derived from petroleum sources and shall not contain any anomalous components

(such as Tall Oil and/or Inorganic Acid Substances) and to be of a stable and homogenous nature.

Fuel have to be free of waste lubricants, chemicals and chemical wastes. Cold flow characteristics of the fuel should be such

that paraffin precipitation does not hinder operability of fuel system components. The fuel shall comply with the specifications of ISO 8217 Table 1 or 2 and to Clause 5 and the Revised Annex VI regulation 18.3. During bunkering, bunker suppliers to comply with reg 18 of Marpol Annex VI and the guidelines set out in IMO res Mepc.182(59) guidelines for representative drip samples to be drawn from ship’s manifold.

Bunker specifications to conform with any local and/or state and/or international regulations prevailing at any areas, ports and/or places vessel calls/sails.

ANY PERIODS WHERE VESSEL SPEED IS REDUCED DUE TO NARROW/RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, POOR VISIBILITY, FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VESSEL, OR DUE TO CHARTERERS INSTRUCTIONS OR WHEN THE VESSEL HAS TO FOLLOW RECOMMENDED AND/OR MANDATED SPEEDS WHICH MAY BE SUGGESTED BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF HOLDS, WHEN THE VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPRANATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS, ARE TO BE EXCLUDED FROM THE ANALYSIS AND ARE NOT SUBJECT TO ANY PERFORMANCE CLAIM.

ANY ADMISABLE PERIOD OF GOOD WEATHER HAS TO BE A PERIOD OF 24 CONSECUTIVE HOURS RUNNING FROM NOON TO NOON. ANY STEAMING DAYS WITH NET ADVERSE CURRENTS ARE NOT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE “GOOD WEATHER” ANALYSIS FOR CALCULATIONS OF A GOOD WEATHER PERFORMANCE SPEED. ANY PERIODS WHERE VESSEL SPEED IS REDUCED DUE TO NARROW/RESTRICTED/CONGESTED WATERS, POOR VISIBILITY, FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VESSEL, OR DUE TO CHARTERERS INSTRUCTIONS OR WHEN THE VESSEL HAS TO FOLLOW RECOMMENDED AND/OR MANDATED SPEEDS WHICH MAY BE SUGGESTED BY LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ANY PERIODS WHEN VESSEL IS BALLASTING/DE-BALLASTING OR DURING CLEANING OF HOLDS, WHEN THE VESSEL IS FOLLOWING/PROCEEDING IN CONVOY, USING ESCORTS, OR FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS OF UNDERWRITERS, GOVERNMENT OF NATION UNDER WHOSE FLAG THE VESSEL SAILS, SECURITY COUNCIL OF THE UNITED NATIONS OR OTHER SUPRANATIONAL BODY WHEN NAVIGATING IN PIRATE INFESTED AREAS, ARE TO BE EXCLUDED FROM THE ANALYSIS AND ARE NOT SUBJECT TO ANY PERFORMANCE CLAIM.

WEATHER ROUTING COMPANY CALCULATION FOR GOOD WEATHER DAYS SHALL BE ONLY APPLICABLE AND LIMITED FOR THE GOOD WEATHER DAYS ONLY AND CANNOT BE SPREAD ALL OVER THE ENTIRE VOYAGE.
